articles.content:

articles.title: Identical twins must both pay maintenance
articles.description: The Brazilian brothers had refused to admit who the father of the baby was, a judge says.
articles.content:
Image caption
 DNA tests concluded that either man could be the father
A judge in Brazil has ordered identical twin brothers to pay maintenance to a child whose paternity could not be established.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Algeria's President Bouteflika 'resigns'
articles.description: Algeria's president Abdelaziz Bouteflika quits after weeks of mass protests demanding the 82-year-old step down - state news agency.
articles.content:
Algeria's President Abdelaziz Bouteflika has resigned after weeks of mass protests, the state news agency APS reports. 
Mr Bouteflika, who had been in power for 20 years, had already dropped plans to seek a fifth term as opposition to his rule grew. 
The po… [+467 chars]

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: UK needs further Brexit extension - May
articles.description: Theresa May says UK needs extension to Brexit and offers to work with Labour's Jeremy Corbyn to end stalemate
articles.content:
Theresa May will ask the EU for an extension to the Brexit deadline to "break the log jam" in Parliament. 
The PM says she wants to meet Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn to agree a plan on the future relationship with the EU.
But she insisted her withdrawal agre… [+501 chars]

articles.title: The neo-Nazi paedophile who plotted to kill

articles.content: A jury has been unable to decide whether Jack Renshaw, a neo-Nazi who admitted a terrorist plot to kill an MP, remained a member of a banned terrorist group. At the end of his fourth and final trial of the past two years, the full story of those cases can now… [+16532 chars]
